ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Treasure changes in Frontier Mountains
ygData.msgSnippet: Wow, I have gotten coin off every single giant I have fought at the castle. We got three weapons and some words last night, but no loop ;-( Kit ... From: Bill
ygData.messageBody:
Wow, I have gotten coin off every single giant I have fought at the castle.
We got three weapons and some words last night, but no loop ;-(

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Bill Mann [mailto:dabard@...]
Sent: Thursday, June 08, 2000 5:34 PM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'; eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Treasure changes in Frontier Mountains


>Anyone notice any difference in the drops in Frontier since the patch?


Funny you should ask...
Last night some guildmates and I decided to camp the giants in FV (it's
rarely taken on The Rathe). After breaking the camp, we settled into a nice
three hour session of "Pop-n-Pull", (Me-34th lvl bard, 36 druid, 39 then
dinged to 40 druid, a 40-ish mage, then later a 32 druid joined us), except
for one time where our puller pulled one and another spawned right in his
path. While the exp was nice, the loot was not worth our time. All told,
we came away with 1 Black Pearl, 1 Axe of the Iron Back, a Word, and a sum
total of 10pp in coins. Was I expecting Forest Loops in every drop? No.
But to personally loot 8-9 giants and have 5 or 6 with *nothing* (no items
or money) is just wrong. From even just a coinage standpoint, I would have
come out muuuuch better by far if I had just gone to SK and camped the
Hermit :oP
Is it my imagination, or did someone at Verant make a comment along the
lines of loot being comparable to the difficulty of the creature? FYI:
those giants are quite tough ;o)~

One more thing: How much is Singing Steel going for on the other servers?
Saw a level one bard mule last night auctioning SS Boots. He told me he can
get 15k plat for them. For that much, I'ld rather just try to organize a
guild event in Karnor's and loot them myself :oP

-=B=-
34th
The Rathe
